column6: Materials used by weight or volume
column7: JB HI-FI collected 81 kg (FY22: 1,261 kg) of used The Good Guys uniforms, which were shredded and repurposed into products such as insulation, acoustic panels, suspended ceiling tiles, cushion filling and furniture cushioning.
JB HI-FI collected 16,740 cubic metres of Expanded Polystyrene (FY22 17,030 cubic metres) for recycling from 154 locations (FY22: 107) across our store and warehouse network.

column6: Reclaimed products and thei packaging materials
column7: As the Western Australian Government's Plan for Plastics Stage 121 required, JB Hi-Fi removed thick yellow plastic bags from our WA store network and rolled out 50c user-pays paper bags from 1 July 2022. JB HI-FI continues to offer a $1 reusable bag across Australia.

column6: Energy consumption outside of the organization

column13: Energy efficiency update refers to a report or communication that provides information on the status, progress, or changes related to energy efficiency initiatives, measures, or technologies within a specific context. It may include information on energy savings achieved, energy consumption reduction, or energy efficiency metrics improvements.

column8: Behavioural change about using energy sources
column13: Behavioural change in using energy sources refers to modifying individual or collective behaviours related to the consumption and utilization of various energy sources. This change promotes more sustainable, efficient, and responsible energy practices.

Transitioning towards more renewable energy refers to the shift from traditional fossil fuel-based energy sources to renewable energy sources such as solar, wind, hydroelectric, geothermal, and biomass. Various factors, including environmental concerns, energy security, economic opportunities, and technological advancements drive this transition.

column6: Reductions in energy requirements of products and services
column13: Regulated products must also be displayed with an Energy Rating Label (ERL), and we work with our suppliers to ensure the correct labelling is affixed to each product. ERLs provide consumers with energy performance information at the point of sale and help consumers compare the relative energy efficiency of similar products through the 'Star Rating' and estimated annual energy consumption.

column6: Reductions in energy requirements of products and services
column13: Monitoring and recording energy consumption within a store at short intervals involves regularly tracking and documenting the amount of energy used by various systems and equipment within the store premises. Install energy monitoring equipment such as smart meters; these devices can measure the electricity consumption of specific circuits, equipment, or areas in real time or at short intervals.

column6: Reductions in energy requirements of products and services
column13: This year, we started to use the energy consumption data from these smart meters to baseline the energy usage of our stores. As a result of this work, JB HI-FI has implemented real-time alerts (via email) to notify store managers of energy consumption changes, enabling us to identify and eliminate unnecessary energy usage.
column20: Smart meters, Energy Identification, Energy Usage

column6: Interactions with water as a shared resource
column7: JB HI-FI installed a 250,000-litre water tank to provide clean water.

column6: Operational sites owned, leased, managed in, or adjacent to, protected areas and areas of high biodiversity value outside protected areas
Significant impacts of activities, produces, and services on biodiversity
column13: Sustainable packaging refers to designing, producing, and using packaging materials and methods that minimize environmental impact throughout their lifecycle while effectively protecting and presenting products. Sustainable packaging aims to reduce resource consumption, minimize waste generation, and lower greenhouse gas emissions, contributing to environmental conservation and promoting a circular economy.

column6: Significant impacts of activities, produces, and services on biodiversity
column13: Reducing the use or exploitation of natural resources to preserve biodiversity typically involves implementing strategies and policies to mitigate the negative impacts of resource extraction, habitat destruction, and overexploitation on ecosystems and species. Encouraging sustainable practices in industries can help reduce the depletion of natural resources and minimize biodiversity loss.

column6: IUCN Red List species and national conversation list species with habitats in areas affected by operations

column7: JB HI-FI's scope 1 emissions in 2023 were around 600 t-CO2e.
JB HI-FI's scope 2 emissions in 2023 around 50,000 t-CO2e.
In FY23, the total greenhouse gas emission intensity was around 6.00 tonnes of CO2e.

column13: Solar power generation converts sunlight into electricity using photovoltaic (PV) panels or solar thermal systems. Solar power generation offers numerous benefits, including clean and renewable energy production, reduced greenhouse gas emissions, energy independence, and cost savings on electricity bills.

LED lighting is often promoted to reduce emissions and mitigate climate change due to its energy efficiency and lower environmental impact than traditional lighting technologies such as incandescent and fluorescent bulbs. LED lighting offers significant potential to reduce emissions, lower energy consumption, and contribute to global efforts to combat climate change.

Implementation of net zero emissions refers to the actions taken by JB HI-FI to achieve a state where their greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions are balanced by removing an equivalent amount of GHGs from the atmosphere, resulting in net zero emissions. By transitioning to a net zero emissions economy, JB HI-FI can mitigate the worst impacts of climate change, protect ecosystems and biodiversity, and build more sustainable and resilient future generations.

column6: Nitrogen oxides (NOx), sulfur oxides (SOx), and other significant air emissions
Waste generation and significant waste-related impacts
column13: A recyclability assessment is a process of evaluating the ability of a product or material to be effectively recycled at the end of its life cycle. It involves analyzing various aspects of the product or material, including its composition, design, manufacturing processes, and end-of-life management, to determine its recyclability potential.

column6: Waste generation and significant waste-related impacts
column8: Recycled materials into a new product
column13: JB HI-FI has incorporated recycled materials into a new XCD laptop case range using fabric of at least 90% recycled polyethylene terephthalate (PET) from recovered plastic bottles. JB HI-FI's new XCD cable range includes at least 40% recycled thermoplastic elastomer (TPE), and our new XCD chargers contain at least 33% recycled polycarbonate (PC).

column6: Waste generation and significant waste-related impacts
column13: Using paper bags as an alternative to plastic bags is a common strategy to reduce waste and promote environmental sustainability. Paper bags are typically biodegradable and compostable, meaning they can break down naturally in the environment without causing long-term harm.

Waste and recycling system refers to the infrastructure, processes, policies, and practices that govern the management of waste materials generated by human activities, focusing on minimizing environmental impact, maximizing resource recovery, and promoting sustainable waste management practices. By implementing comprehensive waste and recycling systems that prioritize waste reduction, resource recovery, and environmental protection, communities and organizations can minimize the environmental impact of waste generation.

The target is to achieve a significant reduction in the amount of packaging waste generated nationally by the year 2025. This reduction could be expressed as a percentage decrease relative to a baseline year, with specific targets for different packaging materials.
